content.p: Postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system arise from two distinct origins: Cervical ganglia of the sympathetic chain in the paravertebral region or collateral ganglia in the prevertebral region. Select one of these origins as the best fit for the information presented.

response.feedback: Correct. Smooth muscle of pupil receives sympathetic input from superior cervical ganglion.
Incorrect. Postganglionic neurons in Collateral (prevertebral) ganglion serve abdominal organs and lower body

part.hint: Upper torso and above are served by postganglionic neurons in sympathetic chain ganglia.
